docs.title: Home
docs.text: Early Design Carbon Alternatives (EDCA) — a tool to compare structural systems by material take-offs, cost and embodied carbon at early design stages.

docs.title: Use Cases and Limitations
docs.text: EDCA helps you: - parse control files and inputs - compute span sweeps and material take-offs - estimate embodied carbon and cost per m² - rank system families and export CSV/plots

docs.title: On this site
docs.text:
Use the left navigation (or tabs on top) to explore: - EDCA Overview — architecture, data model, implementation details - Getting Started — install + quick start example - Workflow — running and validating the tool - Developer Guide — structure, tests and contribution notes

If anything looks off, open an issue or a PR on the GitHub repo linked in the header.

docs.title: EDCA Code and Foundations
docs.text:
• EDCA runs on Python
  • Data is in parquets
  • Based on various other tools
  • Various packages are listed all over
  • Things are in .py files
  • Data is in .parquet files
  • Optional user inputs can be added in .csv files
  • Key hardcoded information (schemas, code specs, properties) are in .yml files
  • Filetypes
